New Records: Nitish Kumar Reddy scored his maiden T20I century (74 off 34 balls) and took 2 wickets with his seam bowling. Rinku Singh scored 53 off 29 balls. India scored 221/9, their highest total in the series. India won by 86 runs, their biggest win against Bangladesh in T20Is. Nitish Reddy became the youngest Indian to hit a T20I century since Shikhar Dhawan in 2012.
Key Match Events: Nitish Reddy and Rinku Singh's 108-run partnership (4th wicket) rescued India from 41/3. Reddy hit three sixes off Mustafizur Rehman in one over. Bangladesh's bowlers were ineffective against Reddy, who hit 7 sixes and 4 boundaries. India's bowlers, led by Arshdeep Singh and Washington Sundar, took crucial wickets. Bangladesh's top-order struggles and poor fielding contributed to their loss.
Pre-Game Insights: India were confident of winning the series after the first T20I. Bangladesh's batting order struggled against India's pace and spin. Varun Chakaravarthy dismissed Litton Das in the first over, continuing Bangladesh's poor form against mystery spinners.
Post-Match Reflections: India sealed a 2-0 series win, their biggest achievement in T20Is. The victory highlighted the potential of India's young players. Bangladesh's inability to chase down targets and their batting collapse were key factors in their loss.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played under clear skies, with no interruptions. It was the second T20I of the series. The Arundhati Reddy incident added to the match's intensity. The match saw the return of Suryakumar Yadav, who scored 17 off 8 balls before being dismissed by Mustafizur Rehman.
Others: Abhishek Sharma scored 15 off 10 balls, including two boundaries off Tanzim Hasan. Bangladesh's Mehidy Hasan Miraz and Sanju Samson scored 15 runs in the first over. Shanto introduced Mustafizur Rehman in the sixth over, which proved costly. India's fielding was exceptional, particularly with catches by Shanto and Yadav.
